body.p: Born in Eddyville, Ky on May 21, 1836. Studied Law at the University of Virginia from 1855 to 1856. Began practicing law in Eddyville in 1858. Enlisted in CSA in June of 1861. Fought in Company F, 3rd Kentucky Infantry as First Lieutenant. Transferred to Artillery and became Captain of Cobb's Battery. on February 22, 1864 Cobb was commissioned as Major of Artillery and began command of Cobb's Battalion of Artillery until the end of the war. During his service he fought at Shiloh Murfreesboro, and Vicksburg, among other engagements. on August 3, 1865 he married Virginia Walker. Died in Wichita Falls, Wichita County, Texas on July 20, 1914.
